about: Nice to meet you! I'm an aspiring web and mobile developer with a passion for building practical, user-friendly solutions. I believe that technology should be simple, effective, and enhance everyday life. Whether it’s a website, an app, or a custom solution, my goal is to create intuitive experiences that make a difference. When I’m not coding, you’ll likely find me gaming on my PC, diving into books about history and politics, or enjoying Premier League Darts on a Thursday night.

projects.title: How To Vote 2024
projects.description: A site that was meant to help potential eligible South African voters to get registered on the voters' roll and encourage them to vote for the opposition in the 2024 general elections.

projects.title: Dirt Oval Pointskeeping Program (DORPS)
projects.description: A Windows-platform desktop application that allows point keepers at dirt oval races to effectively keep score of all the races held for a day of racing.

services.brief_desc: I create responsive and user-friendly interfaces with Angular, React, and Bootstrap. Fancy features dont mean much if no one wants to use them because of a bad UI...
For the back-end, I build effective and performant APIs with ASP.NET Web API or Express.js. I also provide other back-end solutions using PHP when needed.
Bridging front-end and back-end, I handle everything from UI/UX to database management, delivering complete and efficient solutions tailored to your needs.
A well-designed database is key to any successful app. I design, optimize, and manage databases to keep data secure, organized, and running efficiently.
A great UI should catch the user's eye while staying intuitive. I focus on UX design to ensure apps and websites are easy to navigate, visually appealing, and actually enjoyable to use.
